page.title: 06Religion in parishes cont.
page.content: poorly attended but the main festivals are well supported.The care of souls is under 3 separate parsons.As with education each village although close in proximity has 3 religious administration areas.Alverton and Flawborough are in the Newark deanery of the Southwall diocese and serve by a retired clergyman who travels in the area to administer clerical duties. Shelton is in the same deanery but served by a team ministry from Newark. Thoroton is in the Cranmer group of parishes and is served by a clergyman who lives outside the area.The villages are served by non-resident clergy all acting in joint parishes, the social contact with the vicar intermittant,and sunday schools etc. The ties between villagers and their local church are being eroded.
